decks.notes: The deck is focused on quickly ramping up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Amulet of Vigor to cheat out powerful lands like Urza's Saga and Lotus Field. By utilizing the Primeval Titan and Scapeshift combo, the deck can rapidly search for and put into play multiple powerful lands to overwhelm the opponent. This allows for explosive plays and the ability to close out games quickly through a combination of land drops, mana acceleration, and powerful land interactions.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a significant amount of mana. It then utilizes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog and Thought-Knot Seer to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms provide additional control elements and threats. The deck also includes cards like Devourer of Destiny and Sowing Mycospawn to create a resilient board presence. Overall, the deck aims to control the game state and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The main concept of this Boros Aggro deck is to utilize aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Seasoned Pyromancer, along with powerful enchantments like Arena of Glory and Goblin Bombardment, to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes control elements like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Thraben Charm to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, cards like Galvanic Discharge and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury provide additional reach and removal options. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain that pressure throughout the game.

Utilize the powerful UrzaTron lands and Eldrazi creatures to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. Use Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opposing strategies and fetch artifacts, while Thought-Knot Seer disrupts their hand. Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger provide massive threats and board control. Sowing Mycospawn and Kozilek's Command offer additional removal and disruption. The deck focuses on mana ramping and powerful threats to dominate the battlefield and dictate the pace of the game.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on aggressive creature plays, utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to quickly build a board presence. It also incorporates burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to clear the way for attacks. The deck includes cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to provide additional damage and pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes mana disruption spells like Mana Tithe and Thraben Charm to disrupt the opponent's game plan and secure victory.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and ramp spells to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. By utilizing cards like Emrakul, the Promised End, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Malevolent Rumble, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also ramping into large Eldrazi creatures like World Breaker. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Return to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game and deploy massive Eldrazi threats to dominate the battlefield.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures. It utilizes a mix of disruptive cards like Ephemerate and Prismatic Ending, along with powerful creatures like Phelia and Phlage, to control the board and chip away at the opponent's life total. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing it to deploy threats quickly and efficiently.Overall, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and win through a combination of efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Birthing Ritual card in combination with creatures like Shardless Agent and Coiling Oracle to generate mana quickly and overwhelm the opponent with a flurry of aggressive threats. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with cards like Subtlety, Force of Negation, and Sink into Stupor while maintaining a strong board presence with creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Harbinger of the Seas. The inclusion of Endurance and Hedge Maze provides additional protection and disruption, creating a versatile and powerful Aggro deck in the Modern format.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to utilize small, fast creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. With cards like Ragavan and Phlage providing early aggression, backed up by spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment, the deck aims to maintain constant pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Ajani and Static Prison provide additional support and control options to help secure victory. Overall, the key concept revolves around aggressive plays and strategic damage output to ensure a fast and decisive win.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board while dealing damage quickly to the opponent. By utilizing cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, along with removal spells such as Prismatic Ending and Solitude, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent while preventing them from executing their game plan effectively. The deck also includes some card draw and protection tools like Teferi, Time Raveler to maintain its advantage and stay ahead in the game.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly ramp into powerful creatures and spells while disrupting the opponent's game plan with control elements. By utilizing the synergy between Birthing Ritual and high-costed creatures like Abhorrent Oculus and Harbinger of the Seas, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain board presence. Additionally, cards like Flare of Denial and Force of Negation provide crucial interaction to counter opposing threats. The inclusion of card advantage engines like Shardless Agent and Coiling Oracle ensures that the deck can maintain its tempo and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

The focus of this Dimir Control deck is centered around disruption and removal, allowing the player to control the pace of the game and manipulate the opponent's resources. By utilizing a mix of counterspells, hand disruption, and targeted removal spells, the deck aims to dismantle the opponent's game plan and maintain the upper hand. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provide additional threats and card advantage, while cards like Quantum Riddler and Undercity Sewers offer alternative win conditions and utility. Overall, the deck excels at controlling the board and outmaneuvering the opponent.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence by playing low-cost artifacts like Memnite and Pinnacle Emissary, while also utilizing cards like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga for ramp. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and use cards like Metallic Rebuke and Engineered Explosives to control the board. Emry, Lurker of the Loch allows for recursion of artifacts while Aether Spellbomb and Tormod's Crypt provide utility. The deck also includes some protection with cards like Shadowspear and Claws of Gix to ensure the aggro strategy can push through.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to aggressively and quickly overwhelm your opponent with a strong board presence of efficient and powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls. Utilizing cards like Goblin Bombardment and Ajani, Nacatl Pariah, you can deal direct damage to your opponent while maintaining control of the battlefield. With cards like Seasoned Pyromancer and Ocelot Pride, you can generate card advantage and maintain tempo, while also having access to powerful removal options like Galvanic Discharge and Thraben Charm. With this deck, the goal is to maintain pressure on your opponent and finish them off quickly.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Overlord of the Balemurk. Stoneforge Mystic tutors for equipment such as Meteor Sword and Batterskull, providing additional threats and utility. Ephemerate and Flickerwisp are used to protect key creatures and re-use powerful enters-the-battlefield abilities. Giver of Runes offers protection for key creatures, while Emperor of Bones and Witch Enchanter provide additional value and card advantage. The deck aims to control the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with a mix of disruption and aggression.

The deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures like Griselbrand using spells like Goryo's Vengeance while protecting the combo with counterspells like Force of Negation. Ephemerate and Faithful Mending provide card advantage and graveyard manipulation, while Quantum Riddler and Psychic Frog offer additional card selection and disruption. The deck also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Prismatic Ending to control the board. Teferi, Time Raveler helps protect the combo and disrupt opponents, while Atraxa, Grand Unifier provides additional synergy and value with its abilities.
